sgcool_label_text:The Singapore Education Publishing Bureau (EPB) was set up by the Singapore Ministry of Education (MOE) in 1967.  EPB worked with the MOE to develop syllabus for Civic and moral education and mother tongue languages. \r\n\r\nThis included song books such as this assembly songs book for young Singaporeans which includes “Singapura” written in 1962 and the national anthem written in 1958. metadata.sgcool_label_text:
The Singapore Education Publishing Bureau (EPB) was set up by the Singapore Ministry of Education (MOE) in 1967.  EPB worked with the MOE to develop syllabus for Civic and moral education and mother tongue languages. 

This included song books such as this assembly songs book for young Singaporeans which includes “Singapura” written in 1962 and the national anthem written in 1958. The Singapore Education Publishing Bureau (EPB) was set up by the Singapore Ministry of Education (MOE) in 1967.  EPB worked with the MOE to develop syllabus for Civic and moral education and mother tongue languages. 

This included song books such as this assembly songs book for young Singaporeans which includes “Singapura” written in 1962 and the national anthem written in 1958.
